title: Keswick Mountain Festival DexShell Hell in the Fells preview
content:
Cyclist magazine
8 Jul 2021

Keswick Mountain Festival's brand new gravel ride takes on some of the best trails the Lake District has to offer. Photos: Thomas McNally

When the Keswick Mountain Festival finally returns to the Lake District on 10th September, a new feature will be on the mind of many of its visitors.

On the Sunday morning at 07:30 a new ride, DexShell Hell in the Fells, gets underway with participants taking on 72km of the best gravel routes the North Lakes has to offer.

So while they'll have Friday and Saturday to enjoy the delights of the festival's live entertainment, family-friendly activities and other sporting adventures including running, hiking and swimming, they'll be prepping themselves mentally to dig deep on the final morning with 2,032 metres of climbing to push through.

Setting off from Crow Park, entrants will skirt around the shores of Bassenthwaite Lake, along the lower slopes of Skiddaw and through Whinlatter Forest, taking the scenic route with the best views in the Lake District National Park.

All riders will receive a free photo, a concert ticket for Friday night and an event T-shirt with electronic chip timing and feed stations to provide the best ride experience. Those that finish in under four hours will get a Gold classification, under five and a half hours will get you a Silver classification and Bronze for under seven hours.

For more information, to buy tickets for the festival and to book your place on DexShell Hell in the Fells for £60, visit keswickmountainfestival.co.uk

To give you a taste of the ride, Craig Scott and Josh Day from route co-developer Cyclewise took to the course. Check out a few of the images from that ride here:
